Instruction: Core and dice the apples. Finely chop the onion and celery.
In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Saute diced apples, chopped onion, and celery until softened.
In a large bowl, combine bread cubes, sauteed apples, onion, and celery.
Add chicken broth, sage, thyme, salt, and black pepper to the bowl. Mix until well combined.
Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish.
Cover the dish with foil and bake for 25-30 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.
Serve hot as a flavorful side dish.
